# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `adl_bed`
* Variable label: `ADL-Difficulties for getting in or out of bed`
* Variable description: `ADL-Difficulties for getting in or out of bed`
* Domain: `Health status and functional limitations`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | Yes
1        | No

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing




<!-- ########################################################## --> 

# Data process

```{r, dataDirectory, echo=FALSE}
datafolder <- "../RData"
```

## China 
### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

 


* Name: `q2043`
* Label: `q2043: getting up from lying`
* Categories:
    + `1 = none` 
    + `2 = mild`
    + `3 = moderate`
    + `4 = severe`
    + `5 = extreme`
* Missings
    + `8 = don't know`
    + `9 = not applicable`
    + `NA`


* Description: 
```{r assign China w1,  echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed','SAGE.chinaINDData', variables=list('q2043'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local China w1,  echo=FALSE}
SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed <- opal.execute(o,'SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed')
vari <- SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed$q2043 # VARIABLE
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
#Categorical_summary(SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed$q2043)
ggplot(SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed, aes(x=factor(q2043))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Getting in or out of bed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `1 into 1` 
* `2,3,4,5 into 0`
* `8 Don't know into 998`
* `9 Not applicable into 996`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:** 
```{r harmo China w1,   echo=TRUE}
SAGE_china_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed$id)
SAGE_china_ds_w1$adl_bed <- car::recode(SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed$q2043, "1 = '1';2 = '0';3 = '0';4 = '0';5 = '0';9 = '996';8 = '998'; NA = '999' ")
SAGE_china_ds_w1$adl_bed <- labelled(SAGE_china_ds_w1$adl_bed, labels = c(Yes=0, No=1,Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript China w1,  echo=FALSE}
vari <- SAGE_china_ds_w1$adl_bed # variable you want to descrive
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
#Categorical_summary(var = SAGE_china_ds_w1$adl_bed, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(SAGE_china_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(adl_bed))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Getting in or out of bed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation China w1,  echo=FALSE}
AfterH <- table(SAGE_china_ds_w1$adl_bed)
X<-table(SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed$q2043)
BeforeH <- c(sum(X[2:5]),X[c(1,7,6)],sum(is.na(SAGE_China_w1_adl_bed$q2043)))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("2,3,4,5->0","1","9->996","8->998","NA->999")
kable(C)
```

 
 


 
```{r importOPAL China w1, echo=FALSE,  echo=FALSE}
val_labels(SAGE_china_ds_w1) <- NULL
label(SAGE_china_ds_w1$adl_bed) <- "Difficulties for getting in or out of bed"
#opal.assign.data(o, 'SAGE_china_ds_w1', SAGE_china_ds_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'SAGE_china_ds_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')

SAGE_m_china_ds_w1 <- SAGE_china_ds_w1
SAGE_m_china_ds_w1$adl_bed <- car::recode(SAGE_m_china_ds_w1$adl_bed, "c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997,998, 999)=NA")
#opal.assign.data(o, 'SAGE_m_china_ds_w1', SAGE_m_china_ds_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'SAGE_m_china_ds_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
```


```{r,  echo=FALSE}
adl_bed<- SAGE_china_ds_w1
save(adl_bed, file = paste0(datafolder, "/china_w1/adl_bed.RData"))
```

## South Africa

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

 


* Name: `q2043`
* Label: `q2043: getting up from lying`
* Categories:
    + `1 = none` 
    + `2 = mild`
    + `3 = moderate`
    + `4 = severe`
    + `5 = extreme`
* Missings
    + `8 = don't know`
    + `9 = not applicable`
    + `NA`


* Description: 
```{r assign Africa w1,  echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed','SAGE.southAfricaINDdata', variables=list('q2043'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local Africa w1,  echo=FALSE}
SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed <- opal.execute(o,'SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed')
vari <- SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed$q2043 # VARIABLE
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
#Categorical_summary(SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed$q2043)
ggplot(SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed, aes(x=factor(q2043))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Getting in or out of bed") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `1 into 1` 
* `2,3,4,5 into 0`
* `8 Don't know into 998`
* `9 Not applicable into 996`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:** 
```{r harmo Africa w1,   echo=TRUE}
SAGE_SA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed$id)
SAGE_SA_ds_w1$adl_bed <- car::recode(SAGE_Africa_w1_adl_bed$q2043, "1 = '1';2 = '0';3 = '0';4 = '0';5 = '0';9 = '996';8 = '998'; NA = '999' ")
SAGE_SA_ds_w1$adl_bed <- labelled(SAGE_SA_ds_w1$adl_bed, labels = c(Yes=0, No=1,Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript Africa w1,  echo=FALSE}
vari <- SAGE_SA_ds_w1$adl_bed # variable you want to descrive
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
#Categorical_summary(var = SAGE_SA_ds_w1$adl_bed, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))
ggplot(SAGE_SA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(adl_bed))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Getting in or out of bed") + ylab("Frequency")
```
